newsitem.title: FRANCE: Renault to sell Volvo stake at right time.
newsitem.headline: Renault to sell Volvo stake at right time.

text.p: French carmaker Renault SA said on Thursday that it was not surprised by AB Volvo's move to sell its 11.38 percent Renault stake and would similarly shed its three percent Volvo holding when the time was right.
"When we judge that it would be a good moment to sell the stake, we will sell it," said a spokeswoman for the French company.
Volvo on Thursday confirmed market rumours that it had sold its stake in the French carmaker, acquired as part of a proposed alliance between the two companies that eventually fell through.
The sale "seems logical to us, and we're not too concerned," the Renault spokeswoman said.

Renault's stock rose to a year high above 187 francs last week, buoyed by a rise in the French stockmarket to record levels, gains in the pound sterling expected to help Renault's results and strong sales of the popular Megane Scenic minivan-styled car.

Volvo said it sold 27.2 million Renault shares for 5.9 billion crowns to Union Bank of Switzerland, shedding the last remnant of the proposed alliance struck in 1990 that collapsed in December 1993, after a revolt by Swedish shareholders.
Renault said it held about three percent of Volvo after a Volvo buyback offer last month. It has 7.75 percent of the voting rights.
Renault's stock closed down 0.17 percent at 172.40 francs.
